alert.note: Alert for Sagadahoc; Waldo; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 12:40PM EST until December 23 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Widespread flooding of urban and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Small streams rise rapidly and could flood low water crossings. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Oxford, Sagadahoc, Somerset, Waldo and York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST Friday. Additional warnings possible thereafter due to continued rises on small stream and creeks. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1217 PM EST, 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with an additional inch or more possible through this evening. This excessive rainfall will combine with snowmelt to produce additional flooding in the region. - Even once the rain has ended small streams and creeks will continue to rise into the overnight. Additional warnings may be needed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, Rochester, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Augusta, Westbrook, and Waterville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
